course_title: Topics in Postcolonial Literature: Writing Independence in Africa
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as AFS 389W 1)
In this course we will explore some of the most powerful literary works produced by African writers since the start of decolonization in the 1950s. How do African writers and filmmakers imagine cultural, economic, political, and sexual independence? In what ways do their texts enact forms of independence and interdependence? To what extent does African literature itself rely on publishers and prizes based outside the continent? While our focus will be on English-language fiction, we will also examine essays and poetry in English, as well as cinema involving Arabic, French, Wolof, and Kiswahili.
course_description: New literatures in English by writers from former British colonies.
schedule_location: TTh 2:30pm-3:45pm in New Psyc Bldg 225 (36 Eagle Ro
